TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed ApplicationGesture extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the available application-specific .

remarks.format: ## Remarks ## XAML Text Usage This class is not typically used in XAML. ## Examples The following example demonstrates how to identify a gesture on an . This example assumes that there is an called `inkCanvas1` and that its event has been connected to the event handler in this example. [!code-cs[GestureSample#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/GestureSample/Window1.xaml.cs#1)] [!code-vb[GestureSample#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/GestureSample/Window1.xaml.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture AllGestures = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Recognizes all application-specific gestures.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture ArrowDown = int32(61497)

Docs.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. The arrow can be drawn in single stroke or in two strokes where one stroke is the line and the other is the arrow head. Do not use more than two strokes to draw the arrow.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture ArrowLeft = int32(61498)

Docs.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. The arrow can be drawn in single stroke or in two strokes where one stroke is the line and the other is the arrow head. Do not use more than two strokes to draw the arrow.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture ArrowRight = int32(61499)

Docs.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. The arrow can be drawn in single stroke or in two strokes where one stroke is the line and the other is the arrow head. Do not use more than two strokes to draw the arrow.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture ArrowUp = int32(61496)

Docs.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. The arrow can be drawn in single stroke or in two strokes where one stroke is the line and the other is the arrow head. Do not use more than two strokes to draw the arrow.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture Check = int32(61445)

Docs.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. The upward stroke must be twice as long as the smaller downward stroke.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture ChevronDown = int32(61489)

Docs.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. Both sides of the chevron must be drawn as equal as possible. The angle must be sharp and end in a point.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture ChevronLeft = int32(61490)

Docs.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. Both sides of the chevron must be drawn as equal as possible. The angle must be sharp and end in a point.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture ChevronRight = int32(61491)

Docs.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. Both sides of the chevron must be drawn as equal as possible. The angle must be sharp and end in a point.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture ChevronUp = int32(61488)

Docs.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. Both sides of the chevron must be drawn as equal as possible. The angle must be sharp and end in a point.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture Circle = int32(61472)

Docs.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. The circle must be drawn in a single stroke without lifting the pen.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture Curlicue = int32(61456)

Docs.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. Start the curlicue on the word you intend to cut.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture DoubleCircle = int32(61473)

Docs.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. The two circles must overlap each other and be drawn in a single stroke without lifting the pen.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture DoubleCurlicue = int32(61457)

Docs.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. Start the double-curlicue on the word you intend to copy.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture DoubleTap = int32(61681)

Docs.summary: Signifies a mouse double-click. The two taps must be made quickly to result in the least amount of slippage and the least duration between taps. In addition, the taps must be as close to each other as possible.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture Down = int32(61529)

Docs.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. This gesture must be drawn as a single fast flick in the downward direction.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture DownLeft = int32(61546)

Docs.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. This gesture must be drawn in a single stroke starting with the down stroke. The two sides must be as equal in length as possible and at a right angle.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture DownLeftLong = int32(61542)

Docs.summary: Signifies pressing an ENTER key. This gesture must be drawn in a single stroke starting with the down stroke. The left stroke is about twice as long as the up stroke, and the two strokes must be at a right angle.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture DownRight = int32(61547)

Docs.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. This gesture must be drawn in a single stroke starting with the down stroke. The two sides must be as equal in length as possible and at a right angle.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture DownRightLong = int32(61543)

Docs.summary: Signifies pressing the spacebar. This gesture must be drawn in a single stroke starting with the down stroke. The right stroke must be about twice as long as the up stroke, and the two strokes must be at a right angle.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture DownUp = int32(61537)

Docs.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. This gesture must be drawn in a single stroke starting with the down stroke. The two strokes must be as close to each other as possible.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture Exclamation = int32(61604)

Docs.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. The line must be drawn first and then the dot drawn quickly and as close to the line as possible.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture Left = int32(61530)

Docs.summary: Specifies a backspace. This gesture must be drawn as a single fast flick to the left.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture LeftDown = int32(61549)

Docs.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. This gesture must be drawn in a single stroke starting with the left stroke. The two sides are as equal in length as possible and at a right angle.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture LeftRight = int32(61538)

Docs.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. This gesture must be drawn in a single stroke starting with the left stroke. The two sides are as equal in length as possible and at a right angle.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture LeftUp = int32(61548)

Docs.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. This gesture must be drawn in a single stroke starting with the left stroke. The two sides must be as equal in length as possible and at a right angle.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture NoGesture = int32(61440)

Docs.summary: Recognizes no application-specific gestures.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture Right = int32(61531)

Docs.summary: Signifies a space. This gesture must be drawn as a single fast flick to the right.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture RightDown = int32(61551)

Docs.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. This gesture must be drawn in a single stroke starting with the right stroke. The two sides must be as equal in length as possible and at a right angle.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture RightLeft = int32(61539)

Docs.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. This gesture must be drawn in a single stroke starting with the right stroke. The two strokes must be as close to each other as possible.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture RightUp = int32(61550)

Docs.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. This gesture must be drawn in a single stroke starting with the right stroke. The two sides must be as equal in length as possible and at a right angle.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture ScratchOut = int32(61441)

Docs.summary: Erases content. This gesture must be drawn as a single stroke that has at least three back-and-forth motions.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture SemicircleLeft = int32(61480)

Docs.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. The semicircle must be drawn from left to right. The two ends of the semicircle should be as horizontally even as possible.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture SemicircleRight = int32(61481)

Docs.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. The semicircle must be drawn from right to left. The two ends of the semicircle should be as horizontally even as possible.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture Square = int32(61443)

Docs.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. The square can be drawn in one or two strokes. In one stroke, draw the entire square without lifting the pen. In two strokes, draw three sides of the square and use another stroke to draw the remaining side. Do not use more than two strokes to draw the square.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture Star = int32(61444)

Docs.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. The star must have exactly five points and be drawn in a single stroke without lifting the pen.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture Tap = int32(61680)

Docs.summary: Signifies a mouse click. For the least amount of slippage, the tap must be made quickly.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture Triangle = int32(61442)

Docs.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. The triangle must be drawn in a single stroke, without lifting the pen.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture Up = int32(61528)

Docs.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. This gesture must be drawn as a single fast flick in the upward direction.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture UpDown = int32(61536)

Docs.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. This gesture must be drawn in a single stroke starting with the up stroke. The two strokes must be as close to each other as possible.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture UpLeft = int32(61544)

Docs.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. This gesture must be drawn in a single stroke starting with the up stroke. The two sides must be as equal in length as possible and at a right angle.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture UpLeftLong = int32(61540)

Docs.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. This gesture must be drawn in a single stroke starting with the up stroke. The left stroke must be about twice as long as the up stroke, and the two strokes must be at a right angle.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture UpRight = int32(61545)

Docs.summary: Has no suggested semantic behavior or action. This gesture must be drawn in a single stroke starting with the up stroke. The two sides must be as equal in length as possible and at a right angle.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Ink.ApplicationGesture UpRightLong = int32(61541)

Docs.summary: Signifies pressing a TAB key. This gesture must be drawn in a single stroke starting with the up stroke. The right stroke must be about twice as long as the up stroke, and the two strokes must be at a right angle.
